functions.name: Utility
functions.text: This module offers utility methods, which can be used for testing and profiling the code. All functions are preceded by the util: prefix.

function.name: eval
function.rule: This function dynamically evaluates $expr as XQuery expression and returns the resulting items.

function.name: run
function.summary: Opens the argument as file and evaluates it as at runtime.
function.rule: This function opens $input as file, evaluates it as XQuery expression, and returns the resulting items.

function.name: mb
function.summary: Measures the memory consumption for evaluating the argument.
function.rule: This function measures the amount of memory that is needed to evaluate $expr. If the value of $cache is true(), the result will be cached. The returned xs:double value represents the amount of memory in megabytes.
function.example: The expression util:mb("1 to 100000") might return 0.
The expression util:mb("1 to 100000", true()) might return 26.678.

function.name: ms
function.summary: Measures the time needed for evaluating the argument.
function.rule: This function measures the time needed to evaluate $expr. If the value of $cache is true(), the result will be cached. The returned xs:double value represents the needed time in milliseconds.
function.example: The expression util:ms("1 to 100000") might return 25.69.
The expression util:ms("1 to 100000", true()) might return 208.12.
